thread.title: Julian Edelman Had One Of The Most Mind-Bending Catches In Super Bowl History | The Huffington Post
thread.title_full: Julian Edelman Had One Of The Most Mind-Bending Catches In Super Bowl History | The Huffington Post

author: Maxwell Strachan
title: Julian Edelman Had One Of The Most Mind-Bending Catches In Super Bowl History | The Huffington Post
text:
Julian Edelman Had One Of The Most Mind-Bending Catches In Super Bowl History When you think back on Super Bowl LI, this is the play you'll remember. 02/05/2017 10:35 pm ET Maxwell Strachan Senior Editor, The Huffington Post Elsa via Getty Images Julian Edelman kept the New England Patriots' Super Bowl hopes alive on Sunday. 
The New England Patriots’ Julian Edelman pulled off one of the most remarkable catches in Super Bowl history on Sunday when he bobbled a 23-yard pass multiple times with three defenders around him before securing the ball. — NFL (@NFL) February 6, 2017 
The play came with just 2:22 left in the fourth quarter and the Patriots down 20-28. Later on the same drive, the team scored a touchdown and completed a two-point conversion, pushing the game to overtime, where they won on a game-winning drive. 
But seriously, come on. This catch was freaking nuts. It's the #Patriots ' turn for a miracle catch. Julian Edelman. Unreal. #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/35HJ9T8A09 — Matthew Schwerha (@MSchwerha) February 6, 2017 It's the #Patriots ' turn for a miracle catch. Julian Edelman. Unreal. #SuperBowl pic.twitter.com/35HJ9T8A09 — Matthew Schwerha (@MSchwerha) February 6, 2017 
Basically everyone, from LeBron James on down, lost their minds watching that play. Wow @Edelman11 !!! Right back ain't cheating — LeBron James (@KingJames) February 6, 2017 What a catch — Mike Trout (@MikeTrout) February 6, 2017 Get the fuck outta here — Eli Apple (@EliApple13) February 6, 2017 What??? — Jordan Spieth (@JordanSpieth) February 6, 2017 AMERICA IS ALREADY GREAT — Greg Howard (@greghoward88) February 6, 2017 HOLY HELL EDELMAN — Zach Harper (@talkhoops) February 6, 2017 New England's helmet catch — Bruce Arthur (@bruce_arthur) February 6, 2017 great Super Bowl
